column4: Ok. I wanna use by flash drive to test live distros. I'm on 10.04. What should I format my drive too and how come when I remove, then plug the drive back in. It doesn't offer me a 'live trial'
All it does is opens the folder to see the files
Well that's the thing I'm trying to avoid constant restarts. I don't mind installing the iso to the drive then just unmount and remount.
What should I always format my drive too?
Cant a thumbdrive be set to autoplay so it runs programs?
Ok. So now for that. I'll restart. What should I format the thing for Fat, ext4,,,
I have UNetBootin. But it makes me format the drive
What do I format too FAT, or ext4. Whats the best

Ok. I'm gonna go slow. I insert the flash drive. I open disk utility, I unmount then format with "don't partition" then I go to "partition./format" Normally I pick FAT. Then I open uNetBootin and have the iso installed to the drive. I then remove said drive, shut down, insert the drive, turn computer back on. Bios is set to boot from usb 1st. However. Sometimes it fails to do so. What should I "partition/format" my thumbdrive too?
Just dd the image onto your USB stick if it's a Linux.
I wish it was that easy. Disk utility usually requires a partition before I remount
No, uh: sudo dd if=your_linux_image.iso of=/dev/sdz
Wherein "sdz" is your usb stick. Note it's "sdz", not "sdz1" or somesuch.
correct. that's how it shows in unetbootin
I had awful experiences with unetbootin myself -- almost always failed on me, so I don't use it nor recommend anyone to.
What do you use? I'll try another no problem
Well as I said, from Linux I use dd, from Windows I use LiLi
